Articles.Content:
Here is for you a true survivor, one of my only aircrafts that has survived from early access to beta to full release (only 3 remain from the early access days ). Anyway moving on, the aircraft is still one of my best flyers even despite the aerodynamic changes and the engine nerfs and still looks the same as it did back then even if some of the stock and modded parts have changed shape and colour.

So here are some picks of the aircraft.

So i hope you enjoy this little WW1 veteran in ksp form .
I've been looking for one of these, also been considering building one myself. It looks good, or at least as good as a WWI bomber can look.
Thanks:). And yea you cant go too wrong with aircrafts that have boxy fuselages and square shaped wings .

Weird though they may be, I really do admire the designs of those early aircraft. Once I get back from school, I've been thinking of making replica craft... Yours looks fantastic, so I'm bookmarking this for future reference

What mod did you use for the rounded out wingtips?

Thanks . Procedual wings mod was used for making the rounded wingtips.

Edited June 3, 2021 by Snark
Link to defunct website removed by moderator

Interesting ... yesterday I was looking at pre-WW1 designs and wanted to build something like this. But first I need a sound generator that works on engine rpm: pokpokpokpokpokpokpokpokpoketc

Time to send a PM to PizzaOverhead, again.
